lines.text: Heeey, ya seen da postman yet?
Naw. You expectin' a letter?
What's it to ya?
Nut'in'. I was jis' wond'rin' who's gonna read it to ya.
[the boys all laugh but one]

[not laughing]
Very witty. Verrry witty.
Hey, you know, guys, I got an idea.

[together]
Yeah?
Does it hurt much?
No dad-burn Yankee's gonna dirty the name of the greatest Dixie rider of the bluegrass ponies.
Whadda YOU guys know about horse racin'?
I seen 'em once... in a news real.
Well, they don't call horses "ponies."
No? My uncle's a bookie, ain't he? Well, he calls 'em ponies.
Well, he's all wet, see? They call 'em geldin's 'n' fillies and maybe stuff like that.
Go on! Phillies is a baseball team!
What's 'e matter, Ben?
Go no, go on, go on...
Wait a minute. Don't go brushin' ME off, you know, 'cause you got a funny look in your face.
Oh, my face ain't no different than the day it was yesterday.
Your mouth ain't tellin' the same story that yo' eyes is.
Guys up at Sing-Sing got more freedom den I got. I haven't left this track in days. All I've been hearin' is horses and seein' horse. It's a wonder I ain't eatin' hay and neighin'.
Ya mean, ya still gonna bet on me?
Sure. Can you think of an easier way t' lose money?
Muggs ain't yella.
I know it, but he's afraid. Afraid of that horse. Afraid of speed.
Oh, I'm scared o' things, too. I mean, like... like... bein' on a high place.
Everybody has some fear. Fear of snakes. Fear of fires. Some people are afraid of losing their jobs or of growing old.
Den... den you mean dere ain't no disgrace in bein' scared.
It's only disgraceful if you fail to fight your fear. Muggs has been fighting but he can't lick it. He's not a jockey, and he never will be.
